New Records: Pete Alonso's three-run homer sparked the Mets to a 12-6 victory over the Dodgers, and Ryne Stanek struck out four batters to earn the win for the Mets
Key Match Events: The Mets bats were too hot, finishing with 14 hits on 34 at-bats to force a Game 6 at Chavez Ravine
Andy Pages had the game of his life, socking two home runs for the Dodgers
The Dodgers' vaunted pitching staff let them down early in the game, with starter Jack Flaherty giving up eight runs in three innings
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets had stared down the brink of elimination twice in this postseason, and they were looking to stay alive in the National League Championship Series
The Dodgers' bats were expected to be hot, but the Mets' pitching staff was able to shut them down
Post-Match Reflections: The Mets' manager emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance, and Ryne Stanek delivered with four strikeouts in 2.1 innings
The Dodgers' manager was disappointed in his team's performance, saying they let the game get away from them
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was a crucial win for the Mets, who forced a Game 6 at Chavez Ravine
The Dodgers' Shohei Ohtani had a brain cramp in the first inning, staying at third base instead of running home on a grounder
The Mets' Pete Alonso made them pay with his first at-bat, golfing a pitch at his ankles to deep center field for a monster 432-foot blast
